intro: Strobilanthes neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Neilgherry Strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the monsoon season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
